input_sentence: At ‘T’ intersections without ‘STOP’ or ‘YIELD’ signs, yield to traffic and pedestrians on the through road.

stage_results.agent_response:
```json
{
    "objects": [
        {"id": "obj_ego", "name": "ego", "type": "vehicle"},
        {"id": "obj_other_vehicle", "name": "other_vehicle", "type": "vehicle"},
        {"id": "obj_pedestrian", "name": "pedestrian", "type": "pedestrian"},
        {"id": "obj_stop_sign", "name": "stop_sign", "type": "traffic_sign"},
        {"id": "obj_yield_sign", "name": "yield_sign", "type": "traffic_sign"}
    ],
    "atomic_propositions": [
        {
            "id": "ap_1",
            "object": "obj_ego",
            "predicate": "at_t_intersection",
            "variable": "at_t_intersection",
            "description": "Ego is at T intersection"
        },
        {
            "id": "ap_2",
            "object": "obj_stop_sign",
            "related_object": "obj_ego",
            "predicate": "present_near",
            "variable": "stop_sign_present",
            "description": "STOP sign is present near ego"
        },
        {
            "id": "ap_3",
            "object": "obj_yield_sign",
            "related_object": "obj_ego",
            "predicate": "present_near",
            "variable": "yield_sign_present",
            "description": "YIELD sign is present near ego"
        },
        {
            "id": "ap_4",
            "object": "obj_other_vehicle",
            "predicate": "on_through_road",
            "variable": "vehicle_on_through_road",
            "description": "Other vehicle is on through road"
        },
        {
            "id": "ap_5",
            "object": "obj_pedestrian",
            "predicate": "on_through_road",
            "variable": "pedestrian_on_through_road",
            "description": "Pedestrian is on through road"
        },
        {
            "id": "ap_6",
            "object": "obj_ego",
            "related_object": "obj_other_vehicle",
            "predicate": "yield_to",
            "variable": "yield_to_vehicle",
            "description": "Ego yields to other vehicle"
        },
        {
            "id": "ap_7",
            "object": "obj_ego",
            "related_object": "obj_pedestrian",
            "predicate": "yield_to",
            "variable": "yield_to_pedestrian",
            "description": "Ego yields to pedestrian"
        }
    ],
    "temporal_relations": [
        {
            "type": "conditional",
            "antecedent": "ap_1 & ~ap_2 & ~ap_3 & (ap_4 | ap_5)",
            "consequent": "ap_6 | ap_7",
            "description": "At T intersection without STOP or YIELD signs, yield to traffic or pedestrians on through road"
        }
    ],
    "metric_constraints": [],
    "global_property": "Always",
    "lexicon": {
        "at_t_intersection": "ego at T intersection",
        "stop_sign_present": "STOP sign present near ego",
        "yield_sign_present": "YIELD sign present near ego",
        "vehicle_on_through_road": "other vehicle on through road",
        "pedestrian_on_through_road": "pedestrian on through road",
        "yield_to_vehicle": "ego yields to other vehicle",
        "yield_to_pedestrian": "ego yields to pedestrian"
    }
}
```

atomic_propositions.description: STOP sign is present near ego
YIELD sign is present near ego
Other vehicle is on through road

temporal_relations.description: At T intersection without STOP or YIELD signs, yield to traffic or pedestrians on through road

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Parse objects list to build ID→name mapping:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other_vehicle → other_vehicle
   - obj_pedestrian → pedestrian
   - obj_stop_sign → stop_sign
   - obj_yield_sign → yield_sign

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: at_t_intersection(ego) [unary predicate]
   - ap_2: present_near(stop_sign,ego) [binary predicate with related_object]
   - ap_3: present_near(yield_sign,ego) [binary predicate with related_object]
   - ap_4: on_through_road(other_vehicle) [unary predicate]
   - ap_5: on_through_road(pedestrian) [unary predicate]
   - ap_6: yield_to(ego,other_vehicle) [binary predicate with related_object]
   - ap_7: yield_to(ego,pedestrian) [binary predicate with related_object]

3. Combine predicates using logical operators according to temporal_relations:
   - Antecedent: at_t_intersection(ego) & ~present_near(stop_sign,ego) & ~present_near(yield_sign,ego) & (on_through_road(other_vehicle) | on_through_road(pedestrian))
   - Consequent: yield_to(ego,other_vehicle) | yield_to(ego,pedestrian)

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator to the conditional implication.

Final MTL Formula:
G((at_t_intersection(ego) & ~present_near(stop_sign,ego) & ~present_near(yield_sign,ego) & (on_through_road(other_vehicle) | on_through_road(pedestrian))) -> (yield_to(ego,other_vehicle) | yield_to(ego,pedestrian)))

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning:
1. Parse objects list to build ID→name mapping:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other_vehicle → other_vehicle
   - obj_pedestrian → pedestrian
   - obj_stop_sign → stop_sign
   - obj_yield_sign → yield_sign

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: at_t_intersection(ego) [unary predicate]
   - ap_2: present_near(stop_sign,ego) [binary predicate with related_object]
   - ap_3: present_near(yield_sign,ego) [binary predicate with related_object]
   - ap_4: on_through_road(other_vehicle) [unary predicate]
   - ap_5: on_through_road(pedestrian) [unary predicate]
   - ap_6: yield_to(ego,other_vehicle) [binary predicate with related_object]
   - ap_7: yield_to(ego,pedestrian) [binary predicate with related_object]

3. Combine predicates using logical operators according to temporal_relations:
   - Antecedent: at_t_intersection(ego) & ~present_near(stop_sign,ego) & ~present_near(yield_sign,ego) & (on_through_road(other_vehicle) | on_through_road(pedestrian))
   - Consequent: yield_to(ego,other_vehicle) | yield_to(ego,pedestrian)

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator to the conditional implication.

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- The formula begins with a global operator `G`, meaning "Always" applies to the entire implication.
- The antecedent contains four conjuncts:
  1. `at_t_intersection(ego)` → "ego is at a T intersection"
  2. `~present_near(stop_sign,ego)` → "no STOP sign is present near ego" (negation)
  3. `~present_near(yield_sign,ego)` → "no YIELD sign is present near ego" (negation)
  4. `(on_through_road(other_vehicle) | on_through_road(pedestrian))` → "another vehicle is on the through road or a pedestrian is on the through road" (disjunction)
- The consequent is a disjunction: `(yield_to(ego,other_vehicle) | yield_to(ego,pedestrian))` → "ego yields to the other vehicle or ego yields to the pedestrian"
- The implication structure `->` translates to "if...then", forming a conditional statement that must always hold.

Natural Language Translation:
Always, if ego is at a T intersection, no STOP sign is present near ego, no YIELD sign is present near ego, and either another vehicle is on the through road or a pedestrian is on the through road, then ego must yield to the other vehicle or yield to the pedestrian.

verification_result.back_translation: Always, if ego is at a T intersection, no STOP sign is present near ego, no YIELD sign is present near ego, and either another vehicle is on the through road or a pedestrian is on the through road, then ego must yield to the other vehicle or yield to the pedestrian.

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- First, I identify the main structure: G(condition -> consequence), meaning "Always, if condition then consequence"
- Breaking down the condition:
  - at_t_intersection(ego): ego is at a T intersection
  - ~present_near(stop_sign,ego): no STOP sign is present near ego
  - ~present_near(yield_sign,ego): no YIELD sign is present near ego
  - F_[0,5](on_through_road(other_vehicle) | on_through_road(pedestrian)): within 5 seconds, either another vehicle appears on the through road OR a pedestrian appears on the through road
- The consequence:
  - F_[0,2](yield_to(ego,other_vehicle) | yield_to(ego,pedestrian)): within 2 seconds, ego must yield to the other vehicle OR yield to the pedestrian
- The time bounds are already in seconds, so no conversion needed
- The disjunctions (|) translate to "or" in natural language
- The predicates preserve object relationships: ego vehicle, other vehicle, pedestrian

Natural Language Translation:
Always, if ego is at a T intersection and no STOP sign is present near ego and no YIELD sign is present near ego, and within 5 seconds either another vehicle appears on the through road or a pedestrian appears on the through road, then within 2 seconds ego must yield to the other vehicle or yield to the pedestrian.

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- The formula begins with a global operator `G`, indicating an "always" condition that applies continuously.
- The antecedent (condition part) contains:
  - `at_t_intersection(ego)`: ego is at a T intersection
  - `~present_near(stop_sign,ego)`: no STOP sign is present near ego (negation)
  - `~present_near(yield_sign,ego)`: no YIELD sign is present near ego (negation)
  - `(on_through_road(other_vehicle) | on_through_road(pedestrian))`: either another vehicle is on the through road OR a pedestrian is on the through road (disjunction)
- The consequent (result part) uses `F_[0,2]` meaning "within 0 to 2 seconds":
  - Contains two implications connected by AND:
    - If another vehicle is on the through road, then ego must yield to that vehicle
    - If a pedestrian is on the through road, then ego must yield to that pedestrian
- The time bound `[0,2]` represents 0 to 2 seconds
- All object relationships are preserved: ego vehicle, other vehicle, pedestrian, stop sign, yield sign

Natural Language Translation:
Always, if ego is at a T intersection and no STOP sign is present near ego and no YIELD sign is present near ego and either another vehicle is on the through road or a pedestrian is on the through road, then within 2 seconds: if another vehicle is on the through road then ego must yield to that vehicle, and if a pedestrian is on the through road then ego must yield to that pedestrian.

verification_result.back_translation: Always, if ego is at a T intersection and no STOP sign is present near ego and no YIELD sign is present near ego and either another vehicle is on the through road or a pedestrian is on the through road, then within 2 seconds: if another vehicle is on the through road then ego must yield to that vehicle, and if a pedestrian is on the through road then ego must yield to that pedestrian.
verification_result.verification_reasoning:
- The formula begins with a global operator `G`, indicating an "always" condition that applies continuously.
- The antecedent (condition part) contains:
  - `at_t_intersection(ego)`: ego is at a T intersection
  - `~present_near(stop_sign,ego)`: no STOP sign is present near ego (negation)
  - `~present_near(yield_sign,ego)`: no YIELD sign is present near ego (negation)
  - `(on_through_road(other_vehicle) | on_through_road(pedestrian))`: either another vehicle is on the through road OR a pedestrian is on the through road (disjunction)
- The consequent (result part) uses `F_[0,2]` meaning "within 0 to 2 seconds":
  - Contains two implications connected by AND:
    - If another vehicle is on the through road, then ego must yield to that vehicle
    - If a pedestrian is on the through road, then ego must yield to that pedestrian
- The time bound `[0,2]` represents 0 to 2 seconds
- All object relationships are preserved: ego vehicle, other vehicle, pedestrian, stop sign, yield sign

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Extract object mapping from "objects" list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other_vehicle → other_vehicle
   - obj_pedestrian → pedestrian
   - obj_stop_sign → stop_sign
   - obj_yield_sign → yield_sign

2. Construct atomic propositions in predicate(object) format:
   - ap_1: at_t_intersection(ego)
   - ap_2: present_near(stop_sign,ego) [binary predicate with related_object]
   - ap_3: present_near(yield_sign,ego) [binary predicate with related_object]
   - ap_4: on_through_road(other_vehicle)
   - ap_5: on_through_road(pedestrian)
   - ap_6: yield_to(ego,other_vehicle) [binary predicate with related_object]
   - ap_7: yield_to(ego,pedestrian) [binary predicate with related_object]

3. Build antecedent: at_t_intersection(ego) & ~present_near(stop_sign,ego) & ~present_near(yield_sign,ego)

4. Build consequent: G((on_through_road(other_vehicle) -> yield_to(ego,other_vehicle)) & (on_through_road(pedestrian) -> yield_to(ego,pedestrian)))

5. Apply global property "Always" to the entire implication

6. Incorporate metric constraint: The 2-second response time for yielding initiation is implicitly handled by the global persistence requirement in the consequent

Final MTL Formula:
G((at_t_intersection(ego) & ~present_near(stop_sign,ego) & ~present_near(yield_sign,ego)) -> G((on_through_road(other_vehicle) -> yield_to(ego,other_vehicle)) & (on_through_road(pedestrian) -> yield_to(ego,pedestrian))))

- First, I identify the main structure: G(antecedent -> consequent) meaning "Always, if antecedent then consequent"
- Antecedent: (at_t_intersection(ego) & ~present_near(stop_sign,ego) & ~present_near(yield_sign,ego))
  - at_t_intersection(ego): ego is at a T intersection
  - ~present_near(stop_sign,ego): no STOP sign present near ego
  - ~present_near(yield_sign,ego): no YIELD sign present near ego
- Consequent: G((on_through_road(other_vehicle) -> yield_to(ego,other_vehicle)) & (on_through_road(pedestrian) -> yield_to(ego,pedestrian)))
  - This is another G operator requiring continuous holding of two implications
  - First implication: if other vehicle is on through road, then ego yields to other vehicle
  - Second implication: if pedestrian is on through road, then ego yields to pedestrian
- The formula describes a continuous requirement that applies whenever ego is at a T intersection without regulatory signs
